title: Delivering an Efficient, Effective, and Accountable Government

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve the efficiency and accountability of government operations by cutting waste, increasing transparency, and implementing performance reforms. It establishes a board to oversee efforts to detect and prevent fraud and duplication in federal spending and assigns officials responsibility for managing these reforms and tracking progress.
potential_concerns: Efforts to cut waste and increase efficiency may lead to reduced contract opportunities and financial burdens for federal contractors, potentially impacting their business sustainability.
Initiatives to eliminate program duplication and consolidate functions could result in job losses or decreased demand for services provided by federal contractors.

Implementation of stringent performance metrics and frequent data-driven reviews might increase administrative burdens on agencies that rely on contractors, indirectly affecting contract terms and stability.
The drive to reduce discretionary spending such as consultants and travel could disproportionately affect small or specialized contractors who depend on government contracts for survival.
